question: Hey you...I wanna audition. I wan... I wanna be a star... I wanna...
Thas a nice pair of jugs.
Valentina...
You don't go through the mirror.
You hit him.
You're out of control. Ever since your mother died...
I don't want to talk about it!
Help! It doesn't work! It's broken!
The game!
The game! The video game! The one we're in!
answer: I d-d-don't know what you're t-t- talking about.

question: Help me!
What?
answer: I'm n-not supposed to be here.

question: What am I going to do?
answer: That's the p-point. It's up to you.

question: What's the trouble?
What did you say?
answer: Fuzzy Wuzzy was a bear, Fuzzy Wuzzy had no hair, Fuzzy Wuzzy wasn't fuzzy wuzzy?

question: I'll be doing worse than that...now, bugger off!
Valentina?
I c-c-can't call you Val, P- Parnassus d-doesn't like it.
answer: He's not here is he? He's inside getting pissed.

question: Are you happy?
answer: Ecstatic. Hey! That's mine! Give it me!

question: Would you really be happy in one of those p-places?... N-not me. Well... m-maybe....with you. Let's run away. Make a new life together. I'll retrain. Computers. Stocks and bonds. We could be happy. Just the two of us.
What?
Why d-do you always have to p- pretend to be so b-brutal?
answer: I'm not pretending. Anyway... I'm under age.

question: Valentina.
answer: I shall be twelve on Wednesday.

question: Don't be ridiculous.
answer: Percy? How old will I be on Wednesday?

question: See? Parnassus says so too. Are you saying he's ridiculous?
Yes you are. I'll tell him.
He takes advantage.
answer: I don't mind. He's extraordinary... Like you.

question: Puhlease.
I go to all this trouble and you leave it.
Are you ill?
answer: Valentina... my miraculous child.. I have something to tell you.

question: Now what?
answer: I should never have brought you into this rotten bloody world!

question: Oh for God's sake!
Percy liked the soup.
answer: Why does everybody want to live forever?

question: That's normal isn't it?
answer: Immortality's a curse! Any fool can tell you that!

question: You know it doesn't agree with you.
And I'll be sixteen on Thursday, so let's not have any more tosh about that.
You think you're so clever and that everybody else is an idiot! You can't stop me growing up just by lying about my birthday! It's ridiculous!
answer: Shut up! Shut up and listen to me! Listen to me! I need to tell you something, before it's too late! One dark winter's night... Many years ago...?

question: Is this going to take long?
answer: QUIET! Many centuries ago, as a matter of fact... ... I was visited... by someone I had hoped never to meet. ... Having captured the wind and tamed the storm ... the Chief Steward, laying down to take his rest, had a disturbing dream... He dreamt that a hooded rider was approaching across the snow-swept plain. A rider who would challenge the very foundations of the world... ... The Steward woke and remembered his dream. What manner of man had he dreamt of, and what did it signify?

question: What exactly do you do here?
Oh.... What's that?
answer: The story that sustains the universe. The story without which there is nothing.

question: Nothing? Really. Are you telling me that if you stop telling a story... This story... something you made up, a fiction... that the universe ceases to exist?
answer: You make it sound so simple.

question: And you believe it? Incredible. It's just incredible to me that you can believe something that can be so easily disproved.
answer: I don't think so. No! Stop!

question: There you are. You see. The story's stopped. No more story... And yet, we're still here, the fire's still burning... It's still snowing. The wind's still blowing. Nothing's changed. Cheer up... I've freed you from this ridiculous nonsense. Now you can use your powers to do something else. Have fun, travel, learn a foreign language...
answer: A sign! A message! That bird was a messenger... from distant places we know not of! Other places! The point is, you're wrong! And I'm wrong! It doesn't have to be us here! Somewhere in the world, at any given time... someone is telling a story! Sustaining the universe! Right now, it's happening. That's why we're still here. You can't stop stories being told somewhere! You can't be everywhere!

question: A weak hypothesis!
I tell you what... You're probably not a betting man but...
answer: And so I made a wager with the devil. Whichever of us won ten converts first, would win the bet... My argument was the importance of the story, the power of the imagination... His, the power of material things, the supremacy of stuff... Naturally... I won. My prize... ... was ever-lasting life. Everlasting torment... Everlasting... Everlasting... Times changed. No one wanted our tales any longer. It seemed as though the Devil, after all... had triumphed... And then... one day.... From the very first moment I saw her, I was head-over-heels in love. She was beautiful, enchanting, delightful, young... But I... I was several thousand years old! How could I woo her? What could I do?

question: Father!...
What do you mean `at what price'?
answer: It'll wait, it'll wait. Another time. Something's happened. You'd better go and see.

question: Typical! You insist I listen to a story and then you don't finish it!
Incredible! I saw somebody d- dancing in the air.. under the b- bridge.. It's true! There was a sh-shadow on the water, when the lightning flashed... You see! The d-dancer!
I t-told you!
I c-can't reach him.
Definitely. Hey, you! I suppose somebody saves your life everyday of the week.
Too much like routine to bother with a thank you.
Percival St. Antoine della Touraine et Sansepolcro da Piemonte the Third. If that proves too difficult, you may call me Percy.
Geographically, in the Northern Hemisphere. Socially, on the margins. Narratively, with some way to go. And your name is...
That's handy. Any credit cards?
answer: What?..Oh..OK... you can have whatever you want.. just don't..

question: ...with your name on them.
answer: Ah...right.. good idea. My wallet... it's gone. Nothing. I've been robbed.

question: S-somebody was trying to k-kill him.
We c-can't let him stay with us.
These marks... I recognize them.
You've been sent by Mr Nick.
Don't toy with me. Tell me you're an emissary from Mr Nick. Tell me you've come with a proposition. Tell me what I want to hear!
He's from Mr Nick.
He's come with a proposal.
All is not lost.
You're welcome.
We can talk here. Sit down, sit down.
So...
The message.
The message! What's the message? From Mr Nick. What does he want?
Problem? What problem?
What!?
You've lost your memory?
answer: I just... it needs time... to recover.

question: You've come here with a message.... A vitally important message from Mister Nick... A matter of life or death... and you can't remember what it is!?
answer: Not at the moment. I'm sorry. It's never happened before.

question: He says you must work... to focus your mind. You can help out front.. sell tickets. Ah, here we are... Try this. You can be `Justice'.
Just like the rest of us.
answer: I think I'll hide behind this.

question: No face. No name. The mystery thickens. I'm going to have to give you a name... ... until you remember who you are, I dub thee Saint George. You can save me from the dragon. George.
You've met Parnassus.
answer: Now you are making fun of me. I'm sorry but, nobody laughs at me without paying the price....ah,ha.

question: Bloody useless! Mr Nick sends an emissary and he can't bloody remember! It's a bloody disaster!
answer: You can't go on. You're drunk.

question: I am not drunk! I'm under considerable stress.
answer: (to Percy You'll have to do it.

question: You shouldn't drink, it doesn't agree with you.
answer: What do you want? I'll do anything.

question: I know.
answer: You're man's lost his memory! He's bloody hopeless!

question: He's not my man.
Tony Shepherd. Little toe-rag. He used to run a big charity. I wouldn't trust him. But then... you don't trust me do you?
answer: For God's sake! Tell me what you want!

question: I just thought...seeing you so upset last night...that you needed a glimmer of hope...maybe a little bet?
No?
Five souls.. two days, eh!?
I told you didn't I?
That he was a wrong-un.
answer: Trust in providence, Percy. Remember the hanging man. The cards don't lie.

question: George... We'd like to know who you really are.
I may be able to help.
What... ?
answer: Alas, this technique has its limitations.

question: But... Did you discover anything?
My name?... What is it?
Anthony Shepherd.
answer: My God! That's it! You're right! Anthony Shepherd! They call me Tony. Tony Shepherd! That's who I am!

question: And... you used to do good works. Something to do with charity I think.
answer: Yes...That's right! That's right! But how?...

question: It's an ancient technique of mental divination, but I'm very rusty and it doesn't always work satisfactorily.
answer: But that's amazing! Brilliant! Was there anything else? That's absolutely fantastic! Thank you. Perhaps I'll remember other things.

question: That's so strange. And horrible.. it's a complete blank. But I do remember I was involved in some sort of charity.. trying to do good, to make the world a better place, you know...inspire people, give them hope.... What an arrogant idiot. What's that?
I mean, the pipe. Where did you get it?
It's mine.
It's not a musical instrument. May I have it?... Please.
Positive.
Don't fool around.
Give it to me!
What's eating Anton?
In love....?
The little snake! I'll skin him alive!
answer: While you're at it, don't forget the other one. The viper, the scorpion, the amnesiac boa constrictor. Tony.

question: Quite another kettle of fish.
And he's going to help us win five souls.
answer: I think he might. Valentina sees good in him.

question: She'd be better off with Anton.
answer: Perhaps I should offer her hand to whoever helps most in winning the next five souls.

question: That's even worse than the other ideas you've had today.
answer: You're not wrong... Ah, Percy, what would I do without you?

question: As old as the universe itself, the great Doctor, versed in every mystic practice known to man, and many more besides, will guide you to your destiny.
T-taking you to the heart of your imagination!
We'll do it together.
answer: No. T-two c-competing imaginations in the Imaginarium at the same time... it's n-not advisable.

question: Eh?
answer: The stronger imagination will overcome the weaker and then there's n-no knowing what might happen.

question: L-leave me alone.
answer: What were you doing to that girl behind the mirror?

question: What are you suggesting?
answer: Oh, c'mon...we all heard her screaming.

question: I was screaming as well. It was t- terrifying...
No, well...you wouldn't. You've n- never been inside the D-Doctor's mind have you?
answer: Your not trying to tell me that mind control stuff is real?

question: You think it's some k-kind of scam, d-don't you?
No... But I d-don't expect you to g- get it... N-not in a million years.
answer: Hang on.. if he can really control people's minds, why isn't he ruling the world? Why bother with this crappy side show?

question: He d-doesn't want to rule the world d-does he?... He wants the world to rule itself!
answer: What a waste... Tell me about the mirror. What's the point of that, if not to razzle-dazzle the public?

question: You're way off the mark. It's a b-bloody great mystery... wrapped in a b-brown p-paper b-bag enema...or do I mean, enigma...
answer: Er... one more thing....Does `first to five' mean anything to you?

question: I'm sorry but.. you're not modern. People want modern. Look. This is modern. It works. Trust me, I understand this world. This kind of mind control. Let's try to meet the public halfway.. the right public.. and in a better part of town.
What?
There'll be a better class of police too.

Excuse me, madam. I'm afraid we can't accept this. We are here to give...not take. We are here to help those in need. If it's money you need, then here it is. If it's the flowering of the soul you need, then here we are but, unfortunately we are booked solid at the moment. But thank you.. I can see you have a generous spirit. Cost? Money is no good in the Imaginarium. This is a refuge for hearts in need of truth. A place for souls to be purified. Madam, why should you care about time? What are your dreams worth in minutes? There are hard choices to be made in life. What about the dreams of the less fortunate in the world. Do you have time for their dreams? Or are you like I once was...do you just despair? Despair at all that is wrong in the world.. ...despair at your inability to do anything to change it.. to make it better...I despaired so much at the powerlessness of my own existence that I took the easy way out...the coward's way...I committed suicide! Yes, that's right, I killed myself. Can you understand my despair? But I was saved...saved by a miracle...The Imaginarium...and Doctor Parnassus. He brought me back from the dead. He gave me a new life. A reason to live. He has given me power to dream again... to dream of a better world. Please, I'm sorry but, we're booked solid at the moment.
answer: Is that child up for adoption? I want to adopt that unfortunate black child. It shouldn't be working like this. It should be in school. Who's in charge here?

question: Madam, congratulations, you have been chosen.
Come forward and enter the Imaginarium.
We don't want your money. We want your hopes and dreams. You may make a donation later, if you wish.
Oh... how gorgeous... Ohhh... What bliss... and I don't even know your name...
Tony. How dashing. Oh, goodness me!
answer: If I'm not wrong, I fear you must go alone.

question: Why would I want to go without you darling?
answer: It's one of the rules... One imagination at a time, free from the influence of another.

question: Boring.
answer: Oh..look... another possibility.. You must make a choice...and... actually, to be honest, I'd strongly recommend this one.

question: But... Rudolph Valentino, James Dean, Princess Di?... all these people... they're dead.
answer: Exactly. To be reborn, first you must die. All of them have achieved a kind of immortality. And we love them all the more for it. They won't get old or fat. They won't get sick or feeble. They are beyond fear. They are forever young. They are gods. And you can join them.

question: You're such a wonderful speaker.
answer: There's not a moment to lose. But your sacrifice must be pure. You have to let go of all these worldly goods. Remember nothing is permanent... not even death. That was so... I had no idea... It's just... incredible. ..how do you do this?

question: No! Wait! I can explain! Give me a chance!
answer: Stop it! L-leave him alone! Stand b-back! I'm warning you!

question: Did you see me!! I almost reached the clouds! I could have...it was incredible...I was almost there...
Absolutely not. Not in law.
No. I didn't.
But, can we not talk about me for a moment.. I want to thank the Doctor for letting me experience the most sublime, inspiring ....
answer: So why were they trying to k-kill you? "Again!" is what they said.

question: What?
answer: The first time they hung you from the b-bridge... right?... B-because you stole their money.

question: Stop saying that! I didn't steal it! I didn't have it. I'd had to invest in infrastructure. I needed more time. When you run a charity you have to give lots of money away. You wouldn't believe the red tape. The Charity Commission are a bunch of fascists. It's incredible. I mean... c'mon give me a break...I almost died today.. and I said I'm sorry... and anyway..... this was supposed to be a special day...it's Valentina's birthday. Happy birthday. For a beautiful woman.
Marks?
answer: They scrawled something on your forehead. Symbols... Signs...

question: I know... It's over....you've won...
And the girl..from the pub.
answer: Sally doesn't count. Do you, gal?

question: You're joking... toying with me. Like a cat with a mouse... As is your privilege.
answer: Sal didn't get to make a real choice. You were gaga. Out for the count. Wouldn't be fair...And you've got four, thanks to your friend Tony. So... we're even... it's not quite over. Not quite. Oh,oh, look at the time...it's 11.

question: Father?
answer: Valentina... my darling girl. We must do another show! Now! Quickly! Get ready to move out!

question: Who was that?
answer: Somebody asking the way. Where's Tony?

question: I overheard you... He wasn't asking the way.
answer: Please! Get everybody together. Another show! Tony! Percy!

question: I want to know what's going on.
Yes, now! I want to know the truth!
What are you hiding?
answer: There are more important things, at this moment!

question: It's something to do with that bloody rambling story you were telling me the night we found Tony isn't it?
So tell me.
answer: What I told you was... the truth. I really am thousands of years old. I have been immortal. I have been mortal. And I have had many dealings with the devil. Too many.

question: What are you saying?...
answer: Remember the woman I was telling you about?.. the one I was so desperately in love with.. so in love that I made a deal with the devil? That was your mother... ...she was so beautiful, so enchanting...so... ... so young. She was everything I had ever dreamed of. I made a choice. I bargained away my immortality. I regained my youth... and I won her. I did! I won her...! ...but at a price...

question: What price?
Tell me...
answer: I... The price of my obsession... I can't say it.

question: Say it.
What?
answer: I was mortal again... on condition that... any children I fathered... would, on their sixteenth birthday... belong to him.

question: Him?... But... didn't...
answer: Your mother never knew. She died before I had to tell her.

question: I don't believe this! It can't be true. It's just another of your wretched stories... A cruel story!
Why do you say these things?
answer: It's true. Every word. But all is not lost. A new wager... The first of five. If I win... you're free... you're mine again.. and we can win! Where's Tony? We can still win!

question: By playing games with the devil!?
answer: With one more show. The day isn't over.

question: No!

All my life you've made me play `Beauty', `Truth', `Justice'... filled my head with dreams and high ideals. All that crap! While... all the time...! The devil was right! You're arrogant! Vain and arrogant! I'm just another one of your stupid wagers!... You're beneath contempt.
answer: Valentina! That's not true! It's not like that! Wait! Come back! Valentina!

question: You fool! You monstrous fool! You should be dead. What are you doing?
What?... How?
answer: I overheard you. You only need one more to win. Me! I'll be that one. I'll take the risk to save Valentina and, hopefully, you sir. We've still got a few minutes.

question: Yes! Yes! Of course! Of course! Thank God! Thank God!
How about thanking me?
I expect nothing in return.
answer: No. You're a saint... A saint.

question: Only Valentina's hand in marriage, if she'll have me...
And, as your son-in-law... perhaps... initiation into the secrets of the trance.
But... Why not?! What's wrong?
answer: My mind... I can't concentrate... I'm too upset...

question: You must do it! You have to do it! It's the only way to save your daughter!

Concentrate. You must concentrate. I'll make the right choice. I'm sure of it. I can feel how right it is already. Oh God!... Doctor... We can save her.. you and me. I need this. We both need this. Please. The trance. Bugger!
PULL YOURSELF TOGETHER!... Sir. Concentrate...or you'll have lost her forever.
answer: It's useless... Hopeless... I thought I was strong, but I don't even know how to run away...

question: It's alright... it's alright... Don't cry. It's going to be alright, believe me.
answer: This stupid theatre...!... That's all I've ever known...! I've always believed it was something precious, but it's not... it's a lie...I hate it!

question: Everything's going to be alright... I'll take you away. I'll show you the world. My world. The great big beautiful world I've always dreamed of... You'll love it. Yes?
C'mon then.
answer: Ah, there you are, Tony. Here's something m-might interest you. 'Missing

question: No!
answer: N-not a bad p-picture, Tony. Listen to this Valentina... it's about Tony's b-beautiful world.. ...Anthony Shepherd, who was arrested last week on charges of...

question: Just like my father. Leave me alone. I don't care anymore. I want a new life.
Tony, help me, she's heavy.
answer: What is it now?! Can't we just go inside and get dry. Ostanobuite bas menshi schit!

question: You did it! You made the right choice!
answer: Sustainability's great, if you can achieve it. The problem is, in many cases you simply can't, for a whole variety of reasons. Look, charity, like poor little Olga... ...is always with us, to coin a phrase... Ah, there you are, my lovely. I wouldn't presume to have a 'message' for the Prime Minister... Fortunately for the Foundation, I think we pretty much see eye to eye on most things. You look gorgeous, my love. I knew you wouldn't let me down. This is a vitally important moment for the future of the Foundation. The children of the world are depending on us.

question: All of this is false! It's nothing to do with you! It's all him. It's his imagination!
It's all rotten! A naked lie! You've got to understand! Look at this... ...`Tony Liar'..
'The disgraced director of the children's charity "Suffer the Little Children, who was arrested last..
answer: Stop him. Silence the little bastard!

question: ...who was arrested last week on charges of involvement in the sale of organs from third world children to wealthy Westerners'...unghh!
answer: And now he doesn't stutter! You see!? It was all an act to get cheap sympathy!

question: Anton!!!
Forgive me, Anton. I was wrong.
answer: I know... I'm not a child. I love you, Valentina.

question: Thank God for that! Give me that!
answer: Give us a moment, please. Here's your tube... Here's mine. But mine's just a cheap counterfeit... Look, it breaks... But here's another...

question: Stop!

You've been talking to the devil, haven't you? Let me guess what he said... If you manage to kill me, he'll release Valentina. Yes? Am I right?... I am aren't I? It's all lies. He can't release her. And why not? Because he doesn't have her. He can't have her because she's the prize. He doesn't have five wins. But if you kill me he will, won't he? You'll have lost Valentina forever!
This is ridiculous!
You've got to believe me! For all our sakes!
answer: Are you sure you made the right choice?

question: Look...
Gotcha!
answer: There are three cardinal rules. One, there's no black-magic, only cheap tricks. And... er... I forget the others. Now, where's my daughter?

question: What else could I do, Valentina? What else could I have done... What other choice could I have made?... Damn!... It was the right choice... Of course it was... Of course... But where are you? Where's my beautiful daughter? Where's my darling? How long must I suffer? No, no, no... No more choices, please... No more choices...!!! Percy!
Where have you been?
How long have you been here?
answer: How long's a piece of string? Don't ask daft questions.

question: Thank God I found you. I need your advice. I've got a problematical choice to make.
answer: Problematical my arse! Come on... I know it's against the grain...

question: No! Suburban bungalows and all that they evoke are anathema to me. Dammit Percy! Stop! I've got my pride!
answer: Yeah, it goes just before the fall. Come on... I know it's against the grain...
